column1: Femoral hernia repair is surgery to repair a hernia near the groin or upper thigh.
A femoral hernia is tissue that bulges out of a weak spot in the groin.
Or your surgeon may choose to give you local anesthesia and medicine to relax you.
- The hernia is located and separated from the tissues around it.
In laparascopic surgery: - The surgeon makes three to five small cuts in your groin and lower belly.

Risks for anesthesia and surgery in general are: - Reactions to medicines - Breathing problems - Bleeding, blood clots, or infection Risks for this surgery are: - Damage to blood vessels that go to the leg - Damage to the nearby nerve - Damage near the reproductive organs, for women - Long-term pain - Return of the hernia
These include aspirin, ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), clopidogrel (Plavix), warfarin (Coumadin), naproxen (Aleve, Naprosyn), and others.
- Drinking plenty of fluids and eating lots of fiber to prevent constipation.
